name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. James R. ANDERSON, Appellant

judges: Before EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
JONES, former C. J., took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. James R. ANDERSON, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
The court being equally divided, the judgment of sentence is affirmed.
JONES, former C. J., took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Edward Reif, Philadelphia, Pa., for appellant.

F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Richard A. Sprague, First Asst. Dist. Atty., David Richman, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Division, Albert L. Becker, Asst. Dist. Atty., Philadelphia, Pa., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
373 A.2d 454
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. James R. ANDERSON, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 26, 1974.
Decided June 3, 1977.
Reargument Denied July 18, 1977.
Edward Reif, Philadelphia, Pa., for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Richard A. Sprague, First Asst. Dist. Atty., David Richman, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Division, Albert L. Becker, Asst. Dist. Atty., Philadelphia, Pa., for appellee.
Before EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
